title: 5 detained over protest inside Secretariat
body: Police have detained five leaders of the Secretariat staff over a protest inside the Secretariat area, demanding a 20 percent allowance, in violation of the existing embargo. Police took the five into custody for demonstrating within the restricted zone, said Mianul Islam Fulok, inspector (investigation) of Shahbagh Police Station. "The Secretariat is a designated Key Point Installation (KPI) area, where processions and gatherings are prohibited. But they violated the embargo. They are now being interrogated over the motive behind the demonstration," he told The Daily Star. The inspector further said that the decision on whether a case will be filed against them has not yet been made. Yesterday, employees from various ministries and departments staged a demonstration at the Bangladesh Secretariat, during which they confined Finance Adviser Salehuddin Ahmed for nearly six hours to press home their demand.
